state.full: You're full if you've eaten your fill. You can't eat any more food while full.
state.sated: You're sated if you've eaten recently but you've still got room for a bit more.
state.peckish: You're peckish if you're ready for your next meal
state.hungry: You're hungry if your stomach is growling and you're starting to feel a bit weak.
state.starving: You're starving if everything reminds you of food and you're feeling weak and tired

effect.full: After an hour of being full, you become sated.
effect.sated: After four hours of being sated, you become peckish.
effect.peckish: After eight hours of being peckish, you become hungry.
effect.hungry: After sixteen hours of being hungry, you gain 1 Fatigue and become starving.
effect.starving: For every day you are starving, you gain 1 Fatigue.

state.quenched: You're quenched if you've drunk as much as you can. Drinking more beverages while quenched has no effect on your thirst.
state.hydrated: You're hydrated if you've drunk recently but still could drink more if desired.
state.thirsty: You're thirsty if you've not had anything to drink in a while.
state.dehydrated: If you're dehydrated, you may be getting dizzy, suffering headaches.

effect.quenched: After an hour of being quenched, you become hydrated.
effect.hydrated: After two hours of being sated, you become thirsty.
effect.thirsty: After four hours of being thirsty, you gain 1 Fatigue and become dehydrated.
effect.dehydrated: Every eight hours you spend dehydrated, gain 1 Fatigue.

state.rested: After eight hours rested, you become tired.
state.tired: After eight hours tired, you gain 1 Fatigue and become weary.
state.weary: After eight hours weary, you gain 1 Fatigue and become exhausted.
state.exhausted: Every four hours exhausted, you gain 1 Fatigue.

effect.rested: You're rested if you've recently had a proper sleep.You might be well rested instead if you've had an especially good sleep.
effect.tired: You're tired if you're no longer fully alert, but you're still awake.
effect.weary: You're weary when you really need some rest, if not some sleep, but are still somewhat able to function.
effect.exhausted: You're exhausted if you're on the verge of collapsing, but you're pushing yourself to continue.
